title: Who owns Bozeman’s public parking?
description: So the folks at the Save Bozeman Facebook Page have had a reasonably intense discussion over the big story I published Sunday on how parking demand is shaping development in downtown Bozeman.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Developer discussing mid-rise building at Babcock and Wallace
description: A local construction company says it’s looking at replacing two aging houses at the corner of Babcock Street and Wallace Avenue with a five-story mixed-use building, the latest of several such mid-rise proposals combining housing and commercial space in downtown…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Parking’s cost: As cars pile up in downtown Bozeman, space to store them doesn’t come cheap
description: Here on Lamme Street, on the north fringe of downtown Bozeman, a row of boarded-up houses sits on some of the Gallatin Valley’s most valuable real estate.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Meeting to discuss plan for street and intersection upgrades
description: Engineers working on a new transportation master plan for Bozeman will discuss a draft of their study, including recommendations for street and intersection upgrades, at a public meeting Thursday evening.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Food truck regulations get Bozeman commission’s OK
description: City regulations for food trucks, limiting the hours they and other mobile vendors can operate on Main Street, are on track to take effect by late spring.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Board members say city code relaxations could help housing affordability
description: Members of Bozeman’s affordable housing advisory board, in a meeting with city planning staff Friday, said relaxing certain aspects of the city’s building code could help the city when it comes to housing affordability.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Some seniors struggle with cost of Bozeman living
description: At 72, Betty Johns isn’t looking toward retirement.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Plans filed for new building on Main Street blast site
description: It’s looking like one of downtown Bozeman’s missing teeth — a lot vacant since the 2009 gas explosion that leveled much of a city block on Main Street — could finally be growing back in.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: This Bozeman home lot is selling for $345,000. Here’s why
description: Tucked off South Tracy Avenue in Bozeman, this vacant lot is a dream home waiting to happen.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Average rent for a two-bedroom Bozeman apartment? That’ll be $1,022
description: The average rent for a two-bedroom apartment in Bozeman was $1,022 a month in 2016, according to cost data collected by Prospera Business Network, and the average price of a new home in the city was $364,500.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Homeless advocates pitch tiny houses for Bozeman
description: Could a collection of tiny home-style units, clustered into a village with on-site social workers, help Bozeman get a handle on homelessness?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman Commission endorses food truck regulation concept
description: Bozeman commissioners voiced support Monday for a plan to create new regulations for food trucks and other mobile vendors, measures that would require the businesses to acquire permits and limit the hours they’re allowed to operate on Main Street in…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: North Seventh renewal push has EZ Auto looking at redevelopment
description: Inside the EZ Auto Sales office on North Seventh Avenue, an elderly German shepherd snoozes on the floor. When a postman swings through on his daily rounds, he’s greeted by name by proprietor Bill Albee and his son, Colin.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Food truck regs heading before Bozeman commission for discussion Monday
description: Long-discussed regulations for food trucks and other mobile vendors will head before Bozeman city commissioners Monday, with City Manager Chris Kukulski recommending new licensing fees and limited hours vendors are allowed on Main Street.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Montana cities worry that tax district legislation could hobble economic development efforts
description: Bozeman-area legislator Tom Burnett, introducing House Bill 359 at a state legislative committee in Helena on Wednesday, called it a tax fairness measure aimed at making sure city urban renewal programs don’t pass their buck to county taxpayers.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commission extends interim vacation rental limits
description: Bozeman’s five-member commission voted Monday to give city staff more time to work on regulations for short-term rentals within city limits, extending a temporary stay on Airbnb-style operations in some zoning districts for another six months.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commissioners may extend temporary vacation rental limits
description: It’s been six months since Bozeman commissioners, responding to residents concerned about neighborhood homes being converted to vacation rentals, approved a temporary ordinance aimed at limiting new short-term rental permits while the city pondered further action.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: City says Bozeman sales tax could allow substantial property tax relief
description: Bozeman’s leaders have an uphill battle in front of them as they seek a legislative measure letting them put a local option sales tax before city voters, but they’re hoping some math will help their cause.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: With inventory short, Bozeman housing prices keep climbing
description: With fewer homes available to Bozeman homebuyers, prices pushed higher last year, especially for more affordable condos and townhouses, according to data released by local real estate agents this week.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Neighborhood council chair addresses Bozeman commission
description: Managing rental properties and improving transportation services topped a list of neighborhood priorities presented to Bozeman City Commissioners on Monday.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Saving Bozeman: There's a generational divide on development in the heart of the city
description: Standing on the corner of Black and Olive, feet away from the site that could soon be a towering five-story apartment building, Stewart Mitchell isn’t exactly upbeat on how Bozeman is handling growth in his neighborhood.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: What a living wage is in Bozeman — and who makes it
description: This is no new news to anyone living in Bozeman, but as great as life is in the booming city, it’s getting pretty spendy — at least by Montana standards.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman airport again breaks record for passenger numbers
description: Continuing a seven-year streak, Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport again broke its passenger traffic record in 2016, Airport Director Brian Sprenger said Thursday.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: New Bozeman drought plan aims to preempt summer water woes
description: Between population growth and a changing climate, it’s only a matter of time until a dry year, or two, makes Bozeman very aware of its not-infinite city water supply.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman to appeal Baxter-Davis eminent domain ruling
description: The city of Bozeman will appeal a court ruling that denied its attempt to use eminent domain to acquire right-of-way for a traffic signal at the corner of Baxter and Davis.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: BridgerCare breaks ground on new clinic off Oak Street
description: Bozeman-based BridgerCare, Montana’s largest reproductive health clinic, broke ground this week on a new building off Oak Street, aiming to give the nonprofit space to serve its growing clientele.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Holloran, Kenyon Noble in legal dispute over Element Hotel project
description: Prominent developer Andy Holloran and longtime local construction supply company Kenyon Noble, partners in developing the Element Hotel in downtown Bozeman, have come to legal blows over the project.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: SOBO Lofts, proposed for Pizza Hut site, aim to treat neighbors kindly
description: Can mid-rise development in Bozeman’s core take root without ruining life for its neighbors?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Plans filed for East Main development, anchored by new Heeb's
description: The future home of Heeb’s East Main Grocery will anchor a new commercial development on East Main Street, developer Don Cape Jr. said this week, adding he hopes the project can help revitalize the east end of the city.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Beer index: $5 pints come to more Bozeman bars
description: Like it or not, another big city arrival is making local inroads in Bozeman: $5 pricing on pints of micro-brewed craft beer.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman single-family home and apartment construction up over 2015 totals
description: As 2016 draws to a close in Bozeman, the number of detached homes being built inside city limits is up by nearly a third in the first 11 months of the year compared to 2015, according to city building permit…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman gearing up outreach efforts on possible vacation rental regulation
description: Four months after Bozeman city commissioners passed a temporary measure banning new permits for vacation rentals in some neighborhoods, the city is ramping up its work on long-term regulations with listening sessions and an online survey.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman wants tax flexibility, infrastructure support from Legislature
description: Bozeman’s wish list for the 2017 Montana Legislature, formally adopted by city commissioners Monday evening, focuses on a pair of dueling priorities: tax relief for city property owners and ways to fund infrastructure like streets and sewer lines.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Booming on Manley Road, Map Brewing struggles with parking
description: It’s a common sight, evenings along Manley Road in north Bozeman: As one of the city's newer hot spots, Map Brewing Co. fills up with patrons, so do the gravel shoulders of the two-lane road.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Kagy Boulevard not among $40 million in planned Bozeman street upgrades
description: Adopting five-year plans for major road and intersection projects, Bozeman’s commission has endorsed a recommendation by Public Works Director Craig Woolard to spend $40 million on street upgrades by 2022, focused especially around the county regional park on Bozeman’s west…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commissioners discuss development code tweaks
description: Bozeman’s city commission spent hours Monday evening discussing portions of an ongoing revision to the city’s development code, making no formal decisions but saying they’d like to see the city address issues like transitions between zoning districts.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Commission to discuss allowing higher density in Bozeman neighborhoods
description: Bozeman’s City Commission will discuss Monday whether to encourage greater density in residential zoning districts as part of a broader update to the city development code.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Holloran submits revised design for 5-story Black-Olive project
description: Developer Andy Holloran provided city planners with revised design drawings for his Black-Olive proposal this week, maintaining the apartment building’s five-story height but adjusting exterior materials in an effort to placate neighbors and the city's design review board.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman plans challenge to FEMA floodplain designation in downtown
description: A study by the Federal Emergency Management Agency says a swath of downtown surrounding Bozeman Creek should be designated as floodplain, subject to heightened insurance requirements and restrictions on development.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Homeless, at-risk women to get housing help in Bozeman
description: St. James Episcopal Church and nonprofit HRDC said Wednesday they’re opening up a historic church-owned home in downtown Bozeman as transitional housing to help homeless women get back on their feet.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: As downtown neighbors fret over development, businesses worry about customer base
description: Downtown Bozeman may be booming now, but business boosters say it needs more residential development and live-in customers to secure the future of the city’s commercial core.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: With downtown construction a hot topic, Bozeman commission to review planning docs
description: Under pressure from downtown neighbors concerned about a slew of major developments underway or proposed in the downtown area, Bozeman’s City Commission will discuss the various planning documents that govern the city’s approach to development review at its Monday evening…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Face of Change: Is Andy Holloran, reshaping downtown, the hero Bozeman needs?
description: Andy Holloran, the developer who has transformed entire blocks of downtown Bozeman in recent years, is slumped in a chair at city hall.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Growth the answer to Bozeman’s low wages, consultant says
description: If Bozeman wants to boost wages for its workforce, its best hope is encouraging economic growth so local industries have to compete for skilled employees, an economic development consultant told city commissioners this week.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Officials grapple with justice center bond loss
description: In their first meeting since voters defeated a pair of measures aimed at funding a $71.5 million police and courts campus, elected officials and other advocates for the project met Monday afternoon to lick their wounds and begin hammering out…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: City Commission funds HRDC shelter for homeless youth
description: Bozeman City Commissioners voted unanimously Monday night to provide $30,000 from the city’s affordable housing fund to help nonprofit HRDC operate a small shelter for homeless youth — but only after debating whether the social service is an appropriate use…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Lark expansion set to break ground Monday
description: A 29-room, four-story expansion to the Lark Hotel is set to break ground Monday, backers said this week — though much of the building will actually be assembled offsite thanks to cutting-edge building materials.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Plans afoot to refresh murals along downtown Bozeman blast sites
description: More than seven years after a gas explosion leveled much of a Main Street block in downtown Bozeman, downtown boosters say it’s time for a new set of murals along walls screening a pair of still-vacant lots — and they’re…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Design review board pans Black-Olive aesthetics as neighbors pack meeting
description: Neighbors hoping Bozeman’s development review process will put the brakes on developer Andy Holloran’s Black-Olive project got some welcome news at the meeting of the Bozeman’s Design Review Board Wednesday night as city planners and board members expressed concern with…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: As voters reject law and justice center, officials return to the drawing board
description: With a $71.5 million law and justice campus rejected by both city and county voters in Tuesday’s election, local government leaders said Wednesday they’re heading back to the drawing board.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Voters leaning against law and justice center bond
description: Voters were against two measures to pay for a $71.5 million police and courts building as of early Wednesday morning.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: City adopts master plan for $12M Story Mill park
description: The $12.1 million Story Mill Community Park project underway off Story Mill Road in northeast Bozeman got a freshly adopted master plan Monday evening, endorsed with the unanimous, enthusiastic approval of the City Commission.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Mayor says neighborhood groups are key to preserving small-town feel
description: Bozeman Mayor Carson Taylor, speaking at a lunch-hour panel Friday at the Story Mansion, said boosting neighborhood associations can help Bozeman hold onto its charm even as it adds more residents.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Winco Foods abandons plans for Bozeman store
description: Boise, Idaho-based WinCo Foods, which said in April it was eyeing a Bozeman location for a new store, has dropped those plans because of city design requirements, the company’s developer said this week.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Black-Olive apartment building proposal passes initial review on height, parking
description: An initial review of developer Andy Holloran’s proposed Black-Olive building, discussed at a Bozeman Development Review Committee meeting Wednesday, indicates the project is largely in compliance with city development code requirements.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: MSU says collaboration with city will help address traffic growth
description: A collaboration between the city of Bozeman and Montana State University’s Western Transportation Institute will help the city make the most of its road network as the area’s population continues to grow, the university said Wednesday.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Worried by downtown development, Bogert Park neighbors count cars
description: Concerned about shouldering the burden for more and more spillover parking as bustling downtown Bozeman grows upward, a handful of south side residents are pushing back on what they call unchecked development — by counting cars.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman to waive intersection standards for some west side development
description: Faced with the possibility of shutting down subdivision growth in swaths of west Bozeman because developers are required to upgrade intersections for more traffic, Bozeman’s elected commission voted Monday to waive standards in some situations.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commission will make call on Black-Olive project
description: Bozeman’s City Commission voted unanimously Monday night to make the final call on whether developer Andy Holloran’s controversial Black-Olive project complies with city building requirements.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Keeping it in ag: With Bozeman expanding, is there a future for farming in the Gallatin Valley?
description: The vista on Dylan Strike’s organic farm, just outside Bozeman on a sunny fall afternoon, is nothing short of idyllic.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Talbach House project aims to offer comparatively affordable condos
description: As Bozeman grapples with the consequences of its ever-growing population — among them scarce options for affordable housing — the city is caught in something of a conundrum.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Builders question Bozeman's impact fee spending
description: The Southwest Montana Building Industry Association, long a critic of Bozeman's impact fee program, says a third-party audit it commissioned this year shows the city is breaking state rules governing how impact fee money is used.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Judge throws out city’s Baxter-Davis eminent domain request
description: A state judge has ruled against the city of Bozeman in an eminent domain fight over right of way city officials want to use for upgrading the intersection of Baxter Lane and Davis Street, saying the city can’t condemn the…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Site plan filed for Black-Olive project as neighbors worry about parking
description: Developer Andy Holloran, whose proposal to build an apartment building at Black Avenue and Olive Street on the edge of downtown Bozeman has attracted substantial neighborhood opposition, has filed a site plan for the project with the city planning office.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman sweetens L&J pitch with property sale
description: With less than a month to go until the Election Day decision for the $71.5 million city-county law and justice campus, city commissioners voted Monday night to pursue selling a city property on Rouse Avenue in order to lighten the…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman City Commission to discuss sale of Rouse property Monday
description: Bozeman city commissioners will vote Monday on whether they think selling a city-owned property off Rouse Avenue is in the public interest — contingent, that is, on the passage of a law and justice center bond measure on this fall’s…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Worth the cost? The city and county's law and justice center pitch
description: City and county officials want to borrow $68.3 million to build a $71.5 million police and courts facility — the largest bond issue in Gallatin County history. As the question heads to voters, here’s a look at the proposal’s nuts…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commission funds Graf Street connection from 19th to South Third
description: Bozeman city commissioners, looking to patch up gaps in the city’s transportation grid, voted Monday to spend $2.3 million in street impact fee money for several road projects, including connecting Graf Street between South 19th and South Third avenues.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Manufactured homes for affordable housing, not Syrian refugees, nonprofit says
description: Nonprofit HRDC said Monday that pre-manufactured “cottages” being stored near Belgrade are part of an affordable housing project in the works to serve local families — not, as has been rumored on Facebook, a sign the social service agency is…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Obama wants less regulation on housing development
description: The Obama administration, responding to what it calls a national housing affordability crisis, has issued a policy memo urging local governments to back off on development regulations like density limits and off-street parking quotas.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman names new planning director with experience in Maryland, Wyoming
description: Marty Matsen, the current planning division chief for Gaithersburg, Maryland, has been named as Bozeman’s next community development director, responsible for overseeing the booming city’s building and planning departments.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Local sales tax could raise $30 million a year in Bozeman
description: Here’s a figure or two worth pondering if you’re a Bozeman resident worried about rising property taxes:
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: City received $3 million offer on Rouse Property
description: A Chicago investment group has offered the city $3 million for property along Rouse Avenue, saying it would build at least 300 homes on 7.8 acres.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: More mid-rise projects proposed in downtown Bozeman
description: Trying to keep up with Bozeman’s current crop of downtown developments? It’s time to add two more mid-rise buildings to the list.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commission votes to explore sale of Rouse property
description: Bozeman city commissioners, weeks away from voter judgment on a $71.5 million law and justice center project, said Monday evening that they want to explore the sale of a Rouse Avenue property previously considered for a city police and courts…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Cost derails Kagy Boulevard expansion plans
description: As the city looks at upgrading Kagy Boulevard, the east-west arterial street that carries nearly 16,000 cars a day through Montana State University’s campus in south Bozeman, it’s been hoping to accommodate the area’s thousands of walkers and bikers.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Work begins on Bogert Park stream meander project
description: A city project to return a portion of Bozeman Creek to a more natural state as it flows through Bogert Park is off and running, with the hope of improving water quality and recreational access.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: The walkability gap: As Bozeman grows, can it make low-car lifestyles an option?
description: As you’re reading this, try a quick thought experiment: Picture your home and its surroundings, but subtract the car.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Mayor says MSU should limit admissions to match housing
description: Bozeman Mayor Carson Taylor, speaking at a public forum this week, said he’s worried about the impact of Montana State University’s growing enrollment as the city struggles with rental affordability.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: City taxpayers seeing slight relief in new budget
description: Booming Bozeman’s growing tax base gave city commissioners the chance to cut taxpayers a bit of slack Monday evening, saving a typical taxpayer about $16 over current rates.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman, grappling with growth, names finalists for top planning job
description: Now hiring, for quite possibly the hardest job in Bozeman: the city’s next planning chief.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Subdivision again proposed near Bozeman Beach rec area
description: A local developer who wants to build 20 townhouses bordering the East Gallatin Recreation Area will bring a subdivision proposal before the Bozeman City Commission on Monday.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman’s walkability, visualized
description: How far is your house from the nearest restaurant? Coffee shop? Park?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Oracle moving Bozeman jobs to Texas; sources say more than 100 affected
description: Oracle, the $100-billion computer technology corporation, told Bozeman employees Wednesday that more than 100 positions were being moved to San Antonio, Texas.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Does Bozeman need to chill on parking requirements?
description: This video from the City of Ottawa lays out the case its urban planners are making for relaxing parking requirements — the number of new spaces developers are required to include in building projects.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Joe’s Parkway planning grilled cheese deli expansion
description: Longtime Bozeman grocer Joe’s Parkway — known, in part, for its array of cheeses — is planning a deli expansion that will put its selection to use in gourmet sandwiches.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Could Uber be the future of public transit in Bozeman?
description: This longform feature from The Verge and writer Spencer Woodman, looking at a pilot program in Altamonte Springs, Florida, raises some interesting questions that could apply to Bozeman's mass transit future.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Four-story building proposed to replace old Pizza Hut on Babcock
description: The Pizza Hut lot off Babcock Street in Bozeman, chained off and vacant for years, may be getting new life — in the form of a four-story building combining ground-floor storefronts and upstairs housing.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: More student housing proposed south of MSU campus
description: An Alabama-based company has proposed building student housing south of Kagy Boulevard near the Montana State campus, providing possible relief to a Bozeman housing market crowded in part by the university’s booming enrollment.

title: A Bozemanite's guide to the vacation rental debate
description: With August bringing Bozeman into the dog days of tourism season, there's been plenty said — and remains plenty to say — about vacation rentals.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: $68.3M L&J bond endorsed by Bozeman city leaders, heading to voters
description: With a unanimous vote by Bozeman city commissioners Thursday morning, a $68.3 million bond issue for a new law and justice center cleared its last hurdle and will go before voters in November.

title: Commission approves temporary ban of vacation rental permits
description: Bozeman commissioners voted Monday evening for a six-month halt to issuing permits for vacation rentals in some of the city’s neighborhoods.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman to consider interim ban on new vacation rentals
description: Bozeman’s city commission will decide Monday whether to declare a halt on issuing new permits technically required to operate short-term rentals in some residential neighborhoods.

title: New MSU dorm, Yellowstone, aims to encourage student exploration
description: With nearly two years of construction wrapped up, Montana State’s sleek new $35 million dorm, Yellowstone Hall, is ready and waiting to welcome 400 incoming students to campus life.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: In downtown Bozeman, a developer transforms the skyline with taller, ritzier projects
description: If it’s true that Bozeman needs to embrace density, building up to add housing for its swelling population while avoiding the pitfalls of sprawl, then what happens at the southeast corner of Olive Street and Black Avenue will prove a…

title: YMCA breaks ground on new community center
description: The Gallatin Valley YMCA, pushing forward with a new community center to house its programs, finally got to hold a groundbreaking Wednesday.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: County, cities kick off planning coordination effort
description: Representatives from the often-siloed local government agencies responsible for land management in the Bozeman area held the inaugural meeting of a new coordination committee Tuesday, a milestone that represents a major step forward for planning efforts aimed at helping the…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Growth means more liquor licenses for Bozeman
description: It’s more people, more booze for the Gallatin Valley — with state liquor regulators saying Tuesday they’ll make more alcohol-serving licenses available in Bozeman and other Montana cities because of population growth.

title: Commission hands food truck issue back to business community
description: Discussing potential regulations for mobile vendors like food trucks Monday night, Bozeman commissioners asked the city’s business community to take another swing at tackling the issue.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Health board grapples with requiring city sewer hookups, annexation
description: Bozeman’s city-county board of health found itself divided over an unexpectedly sticky decision Thursday morning — ruling on whether to approve individual septic permits for a pair of existing county homeowners or force them to pay thousands to join the…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Growth outpacing city's ability to handle clogged intersections
description: Even with property owners paying more to help Bozeman’s street grid keep up with growth, the rate of development is outpacing the city’s ability to upgrade increasingly clogged intersections, its head engineer said this week.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Why affordable housing is hard
description: In a nutshell: Because construction is expensive, and lower-income Americans generally can't afford rents high enough to make new development projects pencil out.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Commission extends affordable housing deadlines
description: Bozeman commissioners voted Monday to delay deadlines for producing price-targeted homes under a voluntary phase of the city’s affordable housing program, granting builders and developers a reprieve as they strive to meet city-imposed goals for producing modestly priced homes.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Developer floats proposal for six-story downtown apartment building
description: Developer Andy Holloran of HomeBase Montana, the firm behind a slew of major projects in downtown Bozeman, is now proposing a potential six-story apartment building south of Main Street.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Any guesses what year we ran this headline?
description: As a youngish reporter on the city beat, it's always a bit discouraging to look through the Chronicle's back archives — since you inevitably realize half the stories you write have been done, more or less, by somebody else back…

title: Hastings closing stores, liquidating amid bankruptcy
description: Bozeman’s Hastings store will close by Halloween after the national chain, which is going through bankruptcy proceedings, was bought Wednesday by liquidators.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman’s growth rate tops 4 percent, population likely past 45,000
description: Bozeman added 1,760 people to its population between 2014 and 2015, bringing the city to 43,400 residents, according to U.S. Census Bureau estimates.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commissioners weigh in on vacation rentals
description: City commissioners, continuing an ongoing discussion about short-term vacation rentals in Bozeman’s neighborhoods, said Monday night they want to call a temporary halt on issuing permits that allow the operations in some residential zoning districts.

title: More data needed on downtown parking, consultant says

title: Builders may get extension on affordable housing deadline

title: Plan for Bozeman sports complex moves forward
description: A master plan for a major new city sports complex in west Bozeman calls for the eventual construction of 14 multi-purpose sports fields, as well a 2-acre off-leash dog park and parking for 700 vehicles.

title: Plans filed for YMCA center at Baxter and Love Lane

title: Jam Fusion breakfast joint planned for old Universal Athletics storefront
description: A new breakfast eatery is planned for the downtown Bozeman storefront previously occupied by Universal Athletics.

title: City commission holds initial discussion on vacation rental regulation
description: Regulating vacation rentals, if that’s what Bozeman wants to do, isn’t necessarily going to be straightforward, city commissioners heard Monday evening.

title: Commission to discuss food trucks, vacation rentals Monday

title: Utility locate numbers set another record in Bozeman
description: Requests for utility locates processed by the city of Bozeman — a measure of construction activity — have again broken an annual record over the past year, with city workers receiving 5,928 requests in fiscal year 2016, from July 2015…

title: Trust for Public Land still working on Bridger View redevelopment
description: The nonprofit working with the city to build a flagship community park in north Bozeman said this week it still may use a portion of the property once occupied by the Bridger View Trailer Court for an affordable housing development.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: HRDC to close Amos House as federal homeless funding shifts
description: For years, HRDC’s Amos House has provided temporary accommodations to homeless Bozeman residents working to get back on their feet. This week, though, as federal funding shifts away from transitional housing programs, it’s closing.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman City Commission approves cottage housing ordinance
description: A cottage housing ordinance intended to make it easier to build small, affordable homes in clustered developments got the go-ahead from Bozeman commissioners Monday, despite some skepticism about whether the resulting projects would actually produce lower-priced houses.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: City and county work out justice center cost split, but still no price tag
description: As the deadline approaches to get a new law and justice center for the city of Bozeman and Gallatin County on November’s ballot, city commissioners were briefed Monday evening on a proposed cost split — but the project still doesn’t…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commission delays discussion on vacation rentals, food trucks
description: Faced with a packed agenda Monday, the Bozeman City Commission is pushing back promised discussions on regulating food trucks and vacation rentals.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman budget passes on a split vote as commissioners spar over spending
description: Bozeman’s five-member commission trimmed more than half a million dollars in proposed spending before approving a new city budget late Monday night, but commissioners, debating further cuts, ended up split 3-2 in their final vote.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman pondering cottage housing ordinance to provide affordable homes
description: Could encouraging small, cottage-style homes in clustered neighborhoods be a way for Bozeman to provide residents with affordable, modest homes?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Armory hotel project shows signs of possible life
description: A long-stalled project to renovate the old National Guard armory building in downtown Bozeman into a boutique hotel may not be entirely dead, with backers planning work that will close the adjacent city parking lot next week.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Board suggests city consider Peets Hill site, others for affordable housing
description: Could a plot of land owned by the city of Bozeman on Peets Hill, intended to eventually expand the city cemetery, be used instead to supplement the city’s scarce supply of affordable housing?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman to hold public meeting kicking off strategic planning
description: Bozeman officials will hold a public meeting this week to begin planning a big-picture, long-term vision for the growing community.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Growth and Taxes: Costs for governments and property owners add up as Bozeman expands
description: Growth, for the Bozeman area, hasn’t come cheap.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman planning director Thomas to depart in July
description: Bozeman planning director Wendy Thomas, in charge of the city planning and building inspection departments since April 2013, will leave her post at the end of July so she can join her family in Florida, she said Friday.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman worries about parking revenue shortfall
description: Bozeman’s public parking program has a hole in its budget.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Housing costs pushing area homelessness, speakers say
description: Homelessness is on the rise in Bozeman, said speakers at a forum Tuesday night hosted by social service agency HRDC — though not necessarily the type that’s visible along stretches of North Seventh Avenue.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Lark Hotel expansion gets commission’s OK
description: Not everyone will appreciate the architecture behind a four-story expansion to downtown Bozeman’s Lark Hotel, and that’s just fine, city commissioners said as they unanimously endorsed the project Monday.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman may tackle vacation rental regulation
description: The booming short-term rental market is a boon for property owners and their guests, but permanent residents worry about the commercialization of their neighborhoods.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Land use and the changing west, mapped
description: A major study on land conservation in the American West is out today from the Center for American Progress (a left-leaning DC-based think tank) — including both a slick multimedia narrative a set of interactive maps put together by Bozeman-based…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Eminent domain fight holding up Baxter and Davis signal project
description: A city project to add a traffic signal at the often clogged intersection of Baxter and Davis lanes in northwest Bozeman is on hold because of a right-of-way dispute with a homeowner, Public Works Director Craig Woolard said Friday.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Demolition permit approved for old Bozeman Kmart
description: Bozeman’s planning office has approved a demolition permit for the building that formerly housed Bozeman’s Kmart along North Seventh Avenue.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman will need more major streets to handle growth, engineers say
description: As Bozeman’s population continues to swell in the coming decades, the city’s streets are likely to be cramped, engineers preparing a new transportation plan for the city said Thursday during a public meeting.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Meeting to discuss Bozeman traffic, transportation plan
description: Bozeman residents will have a chance to weigh in on an ongoing effort to revamp the city’s transportation plan Thursday evening, as an engineering consultant working on the project presents his initial findings at Bozeman High School.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Proposed Bozeman budget pushes city to maximum tax rate
description: Bozeman residents are facing another year of rising tax bills under the city’s 2017 budget proposal, which calls for higher tax and assessment rates as the growing city hires staff and invests in infrastructure.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Rialto renovation gets the go-ahead
description: A plan to renovate Bozeman’s long-vacant Rialto Theatre on Main Street was given a green light by Bozeman city commissioners Monday night, clearing the way for what architect Brian Caldwell said would be a $5 million investment in the downtown…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commissioners to review Rialto renovation plan
description: City commissioners will consider Monday a plan by the designers of the Lark Hotel to renovate downtown Bozeman’s long-vacant Rialto Theatre, restoring the historic building’s facade to its 1920s-era appearance and creating a flexible, black box theater-style event space.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Study suggests Bozeman should consider paid downtown parking
description: Is it time for Bozeman to bring back paid street parking downtown?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commission to reconsider portion of North 7th zoning decision
description: A few blocks of a central Bozeman neighborhood are back on the table for a rezoning proposal after city commissioners decided Monday to give Mayor Carson Taylor a chance to change a vote.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Rising land costs among factors driving the price of Bozeman-area housing
description: Why, exactly, is it so darn hard to find an affordable home in Bozeman? There’s no single answer, certainly, but a key part of the puzzle is that the price of land is, well, too high.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Commission OK’s plan for northeast Bozeman brewery
description: Bozeman’s city commission unanimously endorsed an entrepreneur’s plan to open an additional brewery near the Bozeman Brewing Company in northeast Bozeman Monday evening, approving the project despite concerns from neighbors over additional traffic at what they said is the difficult…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Engineers detail possibilities for Kagy Boulevard reconstruction
description: A pedestrian underpass to Bobcat Stadium. Separated bike lanes. Oodles of roundabouts.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: County commissioner questions push for Bozeman-Belgrade bike path
description: Supporters calling for the construction of a bike path along the Bozeman-Belgrade frontage road saw a setback Wednesday as a city-county committee balked at a motion to amend the area’s existing transportation plan in order to help push the project…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Commission OKs Valley Drive subdivision
description: The Bozeman City Commission on Monday unanimously approved an 18-unit subdivision along Valley Drive, despite protests from neighbors.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman-Belgrade bike path advocates rack up signatures on petition
description: A local group that wants a dedicated bike path built between Bozeman and Belgrade along the Interstate 90 frontage road is chugging along with a petition aimed at persuading city and county officials to support the project, an organizer said…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Meeting set to discuss Kagy redesign as bike advocates weigh in
description: What should Kagy Boulevard, the often-clogged arterial bordering the south edge of Montana State's campus, look like after a planned reconstruction project?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: As development encroaches on a county pocket, residents worry about the costs
description: For a handful of county homeowners along the north half of Valley Drive in west Bozeman, their quiet street has been a slice of paradise for decades.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman adopts denser Midtown zoning in hopes of spurring redevelopment
description: Bozeman’s city commission voted Monday night to adopt the bulk of a proposed zoning change aimed at encouraging denser, mixed-use commercial and residential development along North Seventh Avenue.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: City commission to consider Midtown zoning update aimed at spurring investment
description: Bozeman commissioners will take up a proposal Monday aimed at helping revitalize the city’s North Seventh Corridor, aka Midtown, by adopting more flexible zoning and building code requirements in an effort to encourage investing in redevelopment.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: WinCo Foods planning new Bozeman grocery store
description: Boise-based WinCo Foods is eyeing a Bozeman location for a new, potentially 85,000-square-foot store, a company representative said this week.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Three bright spots in Bozeman’s affordable housing struggle
description: This is news to no one in the Bozeman area, but the city is becoming an increasingly tough place to find a place to live — rent or buy.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: I-Ho’s Korean to reopen as Smiling Moose consolidates
description: I-Ho’s Korean Grill owner I-Ho Pomeroy said this week she plans to reopen her longtime Bozeman restaurant in a space formerly occupied by the Smiling Moose deli off West Main Street.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Gallatin County growth rate ranked 24th in nation
description: Population figures released by the U.S. Census Bureau this month have again ranked the Bozeman area among the fastest-growing counties in the nation, estimating Gallatin County’s July 2015 population at 100,739 people — a 3,500-resident increase over a year prior.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: More from Patrick Jobes on Bozeman's oldtime growth
description: I included a fair amount of material from old-time Bozeman sociologist Patrick Jobes in the major feature I published this weekend (looking at the community impacts of migration-driven growth), but he’s a colorful enough writer I figured some of his…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: County endorses planning coordination with Bozeman, Belgrade
description: Gallatin County commissioners voted unanimously Tuesday to endorse a new planning coordination committee with the cities of Bozeman and Belgrade to help local governments navigate the challenges of rapid growth.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Commissioners back tweaking Bozeman historic preservation regs
description: Bozeman city commissioners, considering a study on the city’s historic preservation regulations, voted Monday evening to work toward adjusting those rules in the years to come.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: The transience of youth: As young arrivals flock to Bozeman, how many can build a life here?
description: For Miranda Hodge — like many Bozeman immigrants before her — it was love at first sight.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman OKs revised Loyal Garden condos project
description: Bozeman City Commissioners unanimously approved a revised plan to build a condo complex on land in west Bozeman’s Loyal Garden Subdivision on Monday evening, lauding developer Jesse Chase’s work responding to concerns raised by nearby homeowners.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Pub 317 plans expansion into former Soby’s space
description: Downtown Bozeman bar Pub 317 plans to expand into space formerly occupied by Soby’s Cafe, according to documents filed with the Bozeman planning office, providing the establishment with additional seating and the ability to serve food.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Spectators bar looking at adding retail liquor sale space
description: Spectators Bar and Grill is considering expanding into an adjacent space to offer retail liquor sales, according to planning documents filed with the city last week.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: A Bozeman old-timer? You’re very much a minority now, this data says
description: Another data point on the 'What to make of Bozeman's growth?' front here — per demographic info collected as part of a recent city survey, 4 in 10 Bozemanites have lived here five years or less, and 6 in 10…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Commission OKs plan to build most of Oak Street to five lanes, add roundabouts
description: Bozeman city commissioners adopted a long-term plan Monday to build out Oak Street to five lanes for most of the way between Rouse Avenue and Cottonwood Road.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman Commission to review proposal for Lark Hotel expansion
description: A five-story building project expanding the Lark Hotel in downtown Bozeman will be reviewed Monday at the Bozeman City Commission meeting.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman begins using neighborhood app as communication channel
description: The city of Bozeman announced this week it will begin using neighborhood-focused app Nextdoor as a tool to provide residents with information about topics such as growth and events.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commission's priorities include justice center, landfill
description: Selling voters on a bond measure to pay for a new police and courts building and fixing fumes seeping from the old Story Mill Landfill topped the list of Bozeman City Commission priorities approved late Monday night.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Split Bozeman commission approves $124K strategic planning effort
description: A $124,000 contract to hire an Oregon consultant to help Bozeman conduct a major strategic planning effort was narrowly approved by city commissioners Monday night after being questioned by commissioner Jeff Krauss.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman Commission to debate city priorities for coming year
description: Should Bozeman consider a local minimum wage? Work on developing a park maintenance district? Or just double-down on existing efforts to promote affordable housing, rework city building code and persuade voters to support a new law and justice center?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Does Bozeman need narrower streets?
description: Maybe that chicane on Oak Street deserves more love than it gets after all?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Low Bozeman wages put cost of living stats in perspective

creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Survey: Bozemanites love Bozeman, but worry about cost of living
description: New results from a public opinion survey on Bozeman again give the city high marks for quality of life — but underscore concerns about housing affordability and cost of living.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Amid home price gap, some worry city and county policies promote sprawl
description: At the far edge of city limits in west Bozeman this week, six houses in the Loyal Garden subdivision were listed at an average price of $386,000, according to the real estate website Zillow.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: What Gallatin County had to say about planning back in '98
description: A blast from the past on the land use wonkiness front here, in the form of a vintage-1998 Gallatin County pamphlet my colleague Troy Carter claims to have liberated from some dusty stack of papers on his desk.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: First houses approved under new Bozeman affordabilty plan
description: Bozeman’s planning director has approved plans for a first round of modestly priced homes under the city’s affordable housing program.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman Commission approves new housing plan details
description: Bozeman City Commissioners voted Monday to approve guidelines for the city’s new affordable housing program, acknowledging that it’s a work in progress but saying it’s important to move forward.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Commissioner, builders question new mayor's planning board appointments
description: If new Bozeman Mayor Carson Taylor has had a honeymoon period as he takes the helm of the city’s five-member commission, it came to a jarring end late Monday night as his predecessor, now-commissioner Jeff Krauss, questioned the qualifications of…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Six maps looking at development in the Gallatin Valley
description: Another follow-up here on the major feature we published this last weekend, on growth and development in the Gallatin Valley — this time focused on mapping the development that already exists.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: The Big Sky’ and the Gallatin Valley
description: As an addendum to the major feature we published Sunday, kicking off a series looking at growth and the future of the Gallatin Valley, I want to share the full text of the passage I quoted there in abbreviated form,…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: State of the City: Mayor talks L&J, park tax and minimum wage
description: Newly instated Bozeman Mayor Carson Taylor laid out a slate of priorities for the rapidly growing city in his first annual state of the city address Monday night, urging support for a bond measure to fund a new law and…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Big Sky Crowded: Growth, density and the future of the Gallatin Valley
description: The Big Sky take on the American Dream has long focused on the freedom to stake a claim amid broad horizons, so there's perhaps no greater source of local angst than Bozeman’s rapid growth.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Main Street traffic signal timing improved Bozeman traffic flow
description: A Montana Department of Transportation project to time traffic signals along Main Street has reduced travel times as much as 20 percent for drivers between Fowler Avenue and Highland Boulevard.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commission will take up controversial condo project
description: Bozeman commissioners voted Monday to take authority over a dense condo project proposed for Loyal Garden subdivision, saying controversy around the project makes it appropriate to hold a public hearing and debate its approval even as the developer works with…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Condo plan draws outcry in Loyal Garden subdivision
description: A condo complex proposed on land zoned for high-density housing off Huffine Lane is headed back to the drawing board after attracting criticism from a city review board and a host of neighbors in the Loyal Garden subdivision.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Is Bozeman becoming a model Montana city?
description: Flathead Beacon editor-in-chief (and former Chronicle staffer) Kellyn Brown posted a column today pointing to Bozeman as a "model Montana city."
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Cannery project aims to anchor new economic hub in north Bozeman
description: A former pea cannery off Oak Street in north Bozeman, once an industrial hub for the Gallatin Valley, is receiving renewed life this winter as an economic hub for up-and-coming businesses focused around the creative and service sectors.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Seven reopens as sushi bar and grill in Cannery District
description: Bozeman sushi staple Seven has reopened in an expansive new space in Bozeman’s redeveloping Cannery District — and, the restaurant’s managers say, it’s already attracting crowds.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Carson Taylor's theory of governance
description: We published a fairly lengthy Q&A with Carson Taylor, Bozeman’s incoming mayor today in today's paper. It touched on a broad spectrum of issues, everything from the Law and Justice Center bond measure likely to head to voters this fall…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman airport again breaks traffic record in 2015
description: The Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport has once again broken its annual traffic record in 2015, handling more than 1 million passengers in what it says is a first for a Montana airport.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman’s new mayor on bond measures, jobs and managing growth
description: New Bozeman Mayor Carson Taylor began his two-year term this week, taking office as the city prepares a bond measure to pay for a new police and court building and, amid a booming economy, grapples with the impact of a…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Downtown Lark Hotel plans expansion, intends to add 28 rooms
description: Less than a year after the Lark Hotel opened on Main Street in downtown Bozeman, its owners say they plan to expand, adding another 28 rooms to the widely acclaimed 38-room hotel.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Major affordable rental project underway in Bozeman
description: Construction has begun on a new, 136-unit affordable rental complex off Oak Street in Bozeman, its developers said this week.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: The price of pints: Bozeman's first beer price survey
description: With the holiday season’s family-focused celebrations in hindsight and December heading toward its New Year’s Eve finale, it’s the time of year certain questions beg for the asking.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: New Oracle operations center to bring Bozeman more tech jobs
description: By Eric Dietrich
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Amid boom, advocates question city’s commitment to historic preservation
description: As Bozeman’s real estate market booms, there’s plenty of demand for property in the city’s historic neighborhoods.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Building industry to audit Bozeman impact fee program
description: The Southwest Montana Building Industry Association will hire an outside firm to audit the city of Bozeman’s impact fee program, scrutinizing an area where the two entities spent much of the 2000s embroiled in legal conflict.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman plans spending spree to fix roads
description: Bozeman commissioners approved two five-year street construction plans totaling more than $33 million Monday evening, clearing the way for a flurry of road projects aimed at improving busy intersections and fixing gaps in the city’s roads.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Local YMCA shifts center plans outside Bozeman over street costs dispute
description: The Gallatin Valley YMCA said Friday it is abandoning plans to build a major community center inside Bozeman, relocating outside city limits as a result of differences with city officials over expensive street construction requirements.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Commission endorses final plan, additional money for Bozeman Pond park expansion
description: The Bozeman City Commission approved a final plan for a 9-acre expansion of the Bozeman Pond park off Fowler Avenue on Monday evening.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: New census data shows Bozeman young, educated and saddled with housing costs
description: By Eric Dietrich
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Midtown Tavern slated for old Ferarro’s space
description: The building that once housed Italian restaurant Ferraro’s on North Seventh Avenue in Bozeman is set to reopen as Midtown Tavern this winter under the ownership of 14 North owners Josh and Justine Palmer.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: City transportation plan moving forward without county along for the ride
description: Work on an update to Bozeman’s master transportation plan is moving forward without the formal involvement of officials from Gallatin County, the Bozeman City Commission heard Monday evening.

title: Commission to be briefed on Bozeman transportation plan progress
description: Engineering consultants working on updating Bozeman’s transportation master plan will update commissioners on their progress at Monday night’s City Commission meeting.

title: What you need to know about Bozeman’s new housing plan

title: Bozeman wants feedback on rewrite of city building code

title: Questions (and some answers) about Bozeman's new housing plan

title: Split city commission passes housing plan
description: After more than a year of discussion, Bozeman commissioners late Monday passed a two-stage plan to address the city’s housing crunch by making it easier for residents of modest means to buy a home.

title: Housing affordability plan back on Bozeman commission agenda
description: Affordable housing — perhaps the single most fraught issue facing Bozeman — will be back in front of the city’s five commissioners Monday.

title: City street improvement throws wrench in YMCA project
description: The Gallatin Valley YMCA and its CEO, Andrea Stevenson, hope to build a flagship community center. The city, spurred by Public Works Director Craig Woolard, hopes to patch up the gaps in its often piecemeal street network.

title: Eminent domain for Baxter/Davis project moving forward
description: Bozeman city commissioners voted unanimously to use eminent domain to force the sale of property needed for road upgrades at the intersection of Baxter and Davis lanes.

title: New taproom slated for downtown Bozeman Service Electric warehouse building
description: The Service Electric warehouse in downtown Bozeman, across Rouse Avenue from Hawthorne Elementary School, is poised to see new life as a taproom serving beer and wine.

title: Bozeman to consider eminent domain for traffic signal project

title: Study recommends re-tooling Bozeman’s historic preservation regs
description: A study commissioned by the city of Bozeman recommends a major overhaul of its historic preservation regulations, replacing its existing neighborhood conservation overlay district, or NCOD, with regulations based on smaller historic districts.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Andrus beats Potter for city's top spot; Krauss back to commission
description: Bozeman voters have returned two sitting commissioners to the city’s governing body, electing current commissioner Cyndy Andrus to be the city’s future mayor and current mayor Jeff Krauss to a general commission seat.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commission gives North 7th renewal plan the go-ahead
description: A refreshed urban renewal plan for the North Seventh Avenue corridor — now officially rechristened midtown Bozeman — is moving ahead after a unanimous vote by Bozeman’s five city commissioners Monday evening.

title: North Seventh renewal plan on Bozeman agenda
description: Caught somewhere between the city’s thriving downtown core and North 19th Avenue’s big box building boom, North Seventh Avenue is among Bozeman’s more neglected commercial districts.

title: Lark Hotel group buys Rialto Theatre, plans renovation
description: For the first time in years, there’s hope on the horizon for downtown Bozeman’s long-vacant Rialto Theatre.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Heeb’s among several downtown businesses in transition
description: It’s big news for Bozeman that Heeb’s, the city’s longtime Main Street grocer, will relocate to a new location a few blocks east of its current storefront — but it’s not the only downtown storefront in flux this fall.

title: College Street widening project marks official completion
description: A yearlong project to reconstruct College Street between Huffine Lane and 19th Avenue marked its official completion Tuesday with a brief ribbon-cutting ceremony.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Heeb’s grocery to relocate to East Main and Highland
description: Heeb’s East Main Grocery, an iconic Bozeman business for nearly 70 years, will be relocating to a new development at the corner of East Main and Highland Boulevard, the business said in a post to its Facebook page Monday evening.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Event looks back at when downtown Bozeman was in doubt
description: Is downtown Bozeman worth saving? These days, with the city’s urban core bustling commercially and culturally, it’s hard to remember when that question, in its present tense form, merited a place in the local discourse.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: As ballots head to Bozeman voters, mayoral fundraising tightens

title: Your full-blown guide to Bozeman's coming city election
description: Public Service Announcement: Mail-in ballots for Bozeman’s fall city election are headed to voters this week — and due back Nov. 3.

title: New signal timing may help Main Street traffic

title: Fundraising for new Bozeman YMCA center plugging away
description: A push by the Gallatin Valley YMCA to build a new 20,000-square-foot community center near the Gallatin Regional Park in west Bozeman is making progress, the charity said this week, with initial building plans submitted to the city planning office.

title: Students grill commission candidates at taco shop debate
description: With an exuberant young crowd perched on folding chairs in a taco shop parking lot, Bozeman saw its first and possibly only public debate in this fall’s city commission election Wednesday night — karaoke and all.

title: Does Bozeman need to step up its economic development game? Mayoral candidate says yes
description: As a bicycle-loving, smart-growth-promoting candidate challenging an incumbent city commissioner who shares many of his ideas, architect Brett Potter has his work cut out for him as he makes his pitch to Bozeman voters this fall.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Will Bozeman's progressivism limit it to the wealthy?
description: A letter from today's paper, by Thomas L. Hunter, argues it will.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Longtime residents, one a political fixture, square off in commission race
description: “I think the last time I campaigned was in high school,” says Mel Howe, 76, one of two active candidates in the running to fill the lone non-mayoral seat open on Bozeman’s City Commission this fall.

title: City commission candidates on the issues

creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Mayoral candidates debate how to manage Bozeman's growth
description: Brett Potter and Cyndy Andrus, the two hopefuls squaring off in this fall’s election to be Bozeman’s future mayor, have plenty in common at first glance.

title: Bozeman banks rally behind broadband project
description: Bozeman Fiber Inc., a not-for-profit partnership that seeks to build a fiber-optic network to improve commercial Internet access in Bozeman, has raised $3.85 million in private financing for the project’s first phase.

title: What had Bozeman's founding fathers worried in 1887

title: Meeting to discuss ‘car-lite' transportation to Bozeman-area recreation
description: Ever wish it was easier to get to the world-class skiing and trailheads outside Bozeman without having to get in a car — or pay for gas?

title: New restaurant slated for downtown Bozeman Artcraft building
description: Downtown Bozeman is slated to see another new restaurant in the coming months.

title: Construction begins on 5 West Project

creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Envelope calcs: On average night, 1 in 12 Bozeman occupants are tourists
description: Some eye-popping stats here about the role tourism plays in the Bozeman-area economy—
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commissioners delay action on affordable housing plan
description: Faced with stiff opposition from the building and real estate industries, Bozeman city commissioners voted Monday to delay action on a complex affordable housing plan aimed at making it easier for first-time homebuyers to find homes inside city limits.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: A traffic engineer weighs in on Bozeman's streets
description: Tom Eastwood, a traffic engineer who lives in Belgrade, wrote in after seeing last week's post on a letter writer who's convinced Bozeman has worse traffic than San Francisco.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Forums brainstorm ideas as the Gallatin Valley urbanizes
description: Does Bozeman need a roundabout to ease traffic jams at the intersection of 19th Avenue and Main Street? What about more bike routes on the south and west sides of town? Or a Boulder, Colorado-style green belt to preserve open…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Realtors weigh in on Bozeman's future
description: On the heels of a meeting last week that solicited feedback on Bozeman's building code and future direction, a summit hosted today by the Gallatin Association of Realtors took a look at many of the same issues.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: City commission OKs ‘blight’ designation for North 7th
description: Efforts to spruce up Bozeman along North Seventh Avenue got a boost Monday evening as city commissioners voted to adopt a statement of blight that will make it possible to expand the area’s existing urban renewal district.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: What Bozemanites have to say on housing affordability
description: If you haven't heard, Bozeman staff are pitching a proposed ordinance trying to tackle our cramped housing market with incentives and a potential affordable construction mandate (leaving action directed at the rental market for later).
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: What Bozemanites want from the city building code
description: The city of Bozeman kicked off an 18-month project to rewrite it's unified development code with an open-house public meeting Thursday night — complete with butcher paper-covered tables and city maps soliciting input from the attendees.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman housing affordability plan ready for debate
description: Can Bozeman make a dent in its affordable housing shortage with incentives encouraging builders to bring more modest homes to market? Or will it be necessary to break out a government mandate, too?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman now has a worse traffic problem than San Francisco?
description: A letter published in today's paper, written by John Lorf of Bozeman, argues that the city now has "a worse traffic problem than San Francisco."
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: City seeks input on Bozeman building code rewrite
description: Bozeman’s unified development code — the set of rules at the heart of the city’s efforts to channel land development and construction wisely — is due for a refresh, its officials say.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Artcraft Printers remodeling old Greyhound station
description: Bozeman-based company Artcraft Printers is remodeling the city’s former Greyhound bus station into a new sales office, an employee with the company said this week.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Theological Institute proposed for land off South 19th in Bozeman
description: A 78-acre parcel east of South 19th Avenue at Graf Street is proposed as the future campus for a theological institute, according to an application filed with the city planning department in August.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Whitehall housing project could guide Bozeman efforts
description: Does a Habitat for Humanity project in a small town halfway to Butte hold some answers for Bozeman as the rapidly growing city struggles to address its housing crunch?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Watch: Why Bozeman wants $21 more a year from you for streets, in less than four minutes
description: Still unsure about why Bozeman is raising taxes to put more money into streets? This clip from Monday's city commission meeting, where a new tax district funding upgrades to major streets and intersections met with final approval, probably provides the…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commission approves arterial street district tax increase
description: Citing a lack of alternatives and a pressing need to fill in gaps in Bozeman’s street network, city commissioners voted 4-0 Monday to create a new tax district to fund upgrades to roads and intersections by levying additional charges to…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Where Bozeman is growing
description: (Note: this post contains an embedded pdf that doesn't currently display when its viewed from the blog homepage. Click the headline above for the intended presentation if you aren't coming here from a direct link, and thanks for bearing with…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman Commission to decide on street and arterial district tax increase
description: Bozeman commissioners will vote Monday on whether to create a new arterial and collector street district, raising taxes that would pay for filling in gaps in the city’s street network.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Input wanted: Tough questions for Bozeman commission candidates
description: I’m gearing up to start coverage of this fall’s Bozeman’s city commission elections, and am looking for some help drafting tough questions to put the hopefuls through the intellectual wringer.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman housing project opens with some construction remaining
description: Stadium View, the 499-bed apartment complex off South 11th Avenue and the largest student housing project Bozeman has seen in years, is open for occupancy — mostly.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Commissioners delay decision on ‘blight,’ urban renewal around North 7th
description: Bozeman city commissioners voted Monday to delay the remainder of a discussion about urban renewal in a handful of areas surrounding North Seventh Avenue, concluding that the city should mail notices to property owners before applying a blight designation to…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman ranked 19th wealthiest small city in U.S.
description: Feeling like there’s a lot of money drifting around Bozeman lately? It’s not just your imagination.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Construction begins on affordable rental project
description: Gold spray-painted shovels and hardhat-adorned city leaders ushered in the start of construction on a new affordable apartment building in northwest Bozeman on Tuesday afternoon, breaking ground on a development set to create an additional 48 units of housing for…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Study puts a number to downtown Bozeman truck traffic
description: Just how many semi trucks rumble through downtown Bozeman a day? And, of those, how many are navigating the lights and crosswalks for long-haul trips, instead of serving local businesses within the city?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Irrigation drives Bozeman’s summer water use skyward
description: Just how much city water do Bozeman residents use to water lawns and gardens over the course of a summer?
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Taco del Sol reopening on Main Street
description: Bozeman burrito shop Taco del Sol is set to reopen this morning in the storefront formerly occupied by the Leaf and Bean coffee shop.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Commissioners endorse Stucky Road annexation
description: Despite opposition from several members of the public concerned about losing agricultural land, Bozeman’s five city commissioners unanimously voted Monday to annex a parcel of undeveloped land off Stucky Road.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commission to consider Stucky Road annexation
description: Bozeman city commissioners will take up a controversial annexation proposal for a piece of agricultural land off Stucky Road on the southwest edge of town Monday evening, voting on whether it makes sense to zone the land for apartment-style residential…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: ‘Trust fund not included’: Most new housing downtown likely out of reach for typical Bozeman wage earners
description: A slew of residential projects are underway or proposed in downtown Bozeman, but it doesn't seem likely they'll provide urban housing affordable for residents with typical Bozeman incomes.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: ‘Northside lofts’ slated for edge of downtown Bozeman, to include some affordable units
description: A mixed-use development spanning the better part of a city block is looking likely to take root at the edge of Bozeman's downtown core.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Main Street hotel closes after changing hands
description: The troubled City Center Inn on West Main Street has been sold to a South Carolina-based hospitality company that is planning to build a new hotel on the property, local business leaders said.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Bozeman commission endorses joint justice center plan
description: The Bozeman City Commission unanimously endorsed a plan Monday to ask voters for a police and courts building in collaboration with Gallatin County, taking a step toward placing a major bond issue to finance the facility on the fall 2016…
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Utility locate numbers break another construction record for Bozeman
description: Bozeman’s construction boom has set yet another record as of last week — this time for the number of requests to identify buried utilities processed by the city over the last year — 5,472.
creator: Eric Dietrich

title: Multiple candidates file for city commission election
description: With a rush of last-minute applications for this fall’s city commission elections Thursday, it’s looking like the city will see some competition for its top leadership positions after all.
creator: Eric Dietrich
